subject: Physical Fitness
title: Can You Change Your Fiber Type
description: A fast breakdown of Can You Change Your Fiber Type for builders.

hook.text: If genetics set your fiber ratio, can training actually change it? The answer is complicated.

buildup.text: You can't convert slow-twitch to fast-twitch or vice versa through normal training. The base holds.

discovery.text: But you can shift subtypes. Endurance work converts Type IIx to IIa â€” more fatigue-resistant fast fibers.

twist.text: Detraining reverses this. Stop exercising and IIa fibers drift back toward IIx â€” faster but less enduring.

climax.text: The practical truth: train for what you want. Your fibers will optimize within their genetic range.

punchline.text: You can't rewrite fiber genetics. But you can edit the margins.

quiz.question: What fiber conversion can endurance training achieve?
options: Type II to Type I completely
